member_organisations:
Each of EMHF's 27 members represents a thoroughbred horseracing authority within the European and Mediterranean region. These member racing authorities are listed on the EMHF's website at 
http://www.euromedracing.eu/#!members/c194u
fields_of_interest: Trade, Competition, Consumers, Taxation, Single market, Sport
eu_initiatives:
Member of European Horse Network. 
 
EMHF has published and distributed statements on matters relating to, eg, the financing of horseracing, racehorse welfare, etc. 
 
EMHF has arranged occasional visits to meet key representatives of the European Union or Commission, to discuss matters of relevance to Thoroughbred horseracing in Europe.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
EMHF is the Regional Federation within the International Federation of Horseracing Authorities 
http://www.horseracingintfed.com/ 
 
EMHF is a member of the European Horse Network 
http://www.europeanhorsenetwork.eu/
relevant_communication:
EMHF has recently published the following: 
 
July 2015 A response to the publication of the European Commission Strategy for the Single Digital Market - http://media.wix.com/ugd/59786c_26921b1b3fb44ba7b74aca2b25b25387.pdf 
 
December 2014 Document 'Health and Welfare initiatives in European Horseracing' 
http://media.wix.com/ugd/59786c_ab4987ec3cda46ca8047f40062992633.pdf 
 
July, 2013 Statement on the European Commission’s decision on a Levy for Online Betting on French Horseracing 
http://media.wix.com/ugd/59786c_020c126e2a0123141ead69cfd08e6f03.pdf
goals__remit:
The main objective of the EMHF is to develop relations among European and Mediterranean 
Horseracing Authorities, to coordinate promotion of horseracing in Europe and in 
Mediterranean countries, to defend the its integrity and prestige throughout the world and 
to represent Europe and Mediterranean countries before the International Federation of Horseracing Authorities and the European Union 
bodies.
